Name: DM ORZ GMENU DIABETES MANAGEMENT (UPDATE 7/2023)
Term: Edited 7/21/23 - update to VA/DoD guidelines To me, it seems that without comorbidities and with comorbidities could be the same for the first three agents (metformin, SGLT-2, GLP-1).  This is an opportunity to simplify the menu without needing to separate by the presence of comorbidities.  After that TZD (avoid in CHF and bladder cancer), or DPP-4 (alternative to GLP-1).  Then SFU and insulin.  MTB- CACEDITED 06/28/2023 - Given update to VA/DoD guidelines, needed to shift SGLT2i up on the menu. Also shifted some 3rd line agents around due to cost/guideline recommendations. New order will be: 2nd line SGLT2i, 3rd line SFU, DPP4i, then TZD Wyatt Gold, Pharmacy Informatics Created 8/3/22 per LEAF request #173 for Type 2 Diabetes Management Menu from Shane Crook.  MTB-CAC

Contents.Text: Empagliflozin, Canagliflozin, Dapagliflozin (Weight (-), A1c dec (-0.5 to -1.0))
Contraindicated: Dialysis, pregnant/nursing, DM-1, high risk for ketoacidosis,
Hx of (pancreatic surgery, pancreatitis, or alcohol abuse)
Benefits in ASCVD, CHF, and CKD

Contents.Item: DM ORZ GMENU INSULIN TREATMENT MENU
DM PSOZ EMPAGLIFLOZIN/METFORMIN IR COMBO BID (DM MENU)
DM PSOZ EMPAGLIFLOZIN/METFORMIN SA COMBO DAILY (DM MENU)
DM PSOZ GLUCOSE TABLETS (DM MENU)
DM PSOZ GLUCOSE GEL (DM MENU)
DM PSOZ GLUCAGON EMERGENCY KIT (DM MENU)
DM ORZ GMENU DM SUPPLIES (TEMP)
DM GMRCZ DIABETIC NURSE INSTRUCTION
CHF GMRCZ HOME TELEHEALTH ENROLLMENT OUTPT
CHF GMRCTZ WEIGHT MANAGEMENT OUTPATIENT CONSULT
DM GMRCZ NUTRITION DIABETES EDUCATION CONSULT OUTPATIENT

Contents.Text: Women should discontinue at least 2 months before planned pregnancy
Use high glycemic variability (A1C fluctuation or fasting blood glucose) as a
prognostic indicator for risk of hypoglycemia, morbidity, and mortality
Select A1c Target Range based on risk-benefit ratio, patient characteristics/
for most patients, when it can be safely obtained)
AVOID in CHF and active Bladder Cancer patients
--Prioritize other classes of agents first, especially >= 65 yo
Semaglutide, Dulaglutide, Liraglutide (Weight (-), A1c dec. (-0.5 to -1.0))
Avoid if high risk of pancreatitis
Consider starting temporarily for new presentations of diabetes WITH GLUCOSE
TOXICITY (BGs>300, A1C>10, or polyuria/polydipsia/weight loss). Once glucose
toxicity resolves, simplify and switch to preferred non-insulin agents
If significant variability or not achieving glycemic goals while on insulin
therapy, use real-time continuous glucose monitoring to decrease hyopglycemia

DM ORZ SET NOVOLOG FLEXPEN WITH PEN NEEDLE

(Toujeo) despite adjustments to current regimen or wide swings in blood sugar
due to inablity to adhere to basil insulin regimen because of uncontrollable
variables (i.e. work shifts, dialysis, erratic schedules, etc.)

Name: DM ORZ GMENU PHARM GLUCOSE TEST STRIPS
Term: 8/9/2011 At the request of Shane Crook, Clinical Pharmacist and approval of Ken Strum (menu path added) - This menu path has a series of questions designed to walk the provider to the appropriate order.  All menus associated start with ORZ PHARM GLUCOSE Some menus state IDDM or NIDDM - IDDM stands for Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus NIDDM stands for Non-Isulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus. A. Fortner, CAC

Contents.Text: The prescribing of BG test strips outside of these aforementioned
restrictions will be handled through the nonforumulary/restricted
consult process with the provision of adequate clinical/medical
If patients' request additional BG test strips which do not coincide
with the guidelines nor is there unique clinical/medical justification
supporting an increase in BG glucose testing the patient may be offered
additional strips to be filled outside of the VA at the veteran's own

Contents.Item: DM ORZ PHARM GLUCOSE TEST STRIPS NIDDM
DM ORZ PHARM GLUCOSE TEST STRIPS IDDM
